sentences.sContent: Sara had the task of preparing the agenda for meetings.
sentences.sCn: 萨拉的任务是准备会议议程。

sentences.sContent: I was given the task of building a fire.
the skills required to carry out these tasks
sentences.sCn: 执行这些任务所需要的技能

sentences.sContent: He soon realized the scale of the task he had undertaken .
sentences.sCn: 他很快就意识到他所承担任务的艰巨性了。

sentences.sContent: Our first task is to gather information.
sentences.sCn: 我们的首要任务是收集信息。

sentences.sContent: Monkeys can be taught to do simple tasks .
sentences.sCn: 猴子能被教会做一些简单的事。

sentences.sContent: They have the unenviable task of supervising the most dangerous prison in the country.
sentences.sCn: 他们有个令人头疼的工作，就是管理国家最危险的监狱。

sentences.sContent: Volunteers had the thankless task of distributing campaign leaflets.
sentences.sCn: 志愿者的任务是分发活动传单，吃力不讨好。

sentences.sContent: Trying to bring up a small daughter on your own is no easy task .
sentences.sCn: 独自抚养年幼的女儿不是件轻而易举的事。

sentences.sContent: ...each task starts when the previous task is completed...
...Even the strongest supporters of the reform movement concede that the task of raising achievement among disadvantaged students is hard work...
...he has done a task far more difficult...

phrases.pCn: 艰难的工作，艰巨的任务
艰巨的任务；花巨大气力的工作

trans.tranOther: a piece of work that must be done, especially one that is difficult or unpleasant or that must be done regularly
